result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:13 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: S. Bridges Defendant Kristen Noel Forsythe appeared by phone. 2:09 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy   Defendant Kristen Noel Forsythe appeared by video.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by phone for Kristen Noel Forsythe.  Attorney Holly Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court notes letter from Atty Erdman stating the DE was waiving the Preliminary Hearing. Zoom appearance was approved,  Court informs DE of her right to be here in person.  DE waives that right and wishes to proceed.  DE questions warrant for non-payment.   Warrant was quashed.  Phone number for payment clerk was provided to DE.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court confirms address. Zoom appearances approved for ARGN.  Adjourned: 2:16
